H0.text: Acid is the liquid formed when certain air pollutants dissolve in water droplets in the air.

H1.text: Water is the liquid formed when certain air pollutants dissolve in water droplets in the air.

H2.text: Base is the liquid formed when certain air pollutants dissolve in water droplets in the air.

H3.text: Citrus is the liquid that certain air pollutants form when they dissolve in water droplets in the air.

A4.text: The usual anthropogenic sources are sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxide. They react with water (as does carbon dioxide) to give solutions with pH < 5.

A5.text: Nitrogen dioxide reacts with hydroxyl radicals to form nitric acid: NO2 + OH· → HNO3.
